transcripts.text: Hi everyone, I'm Barry Stagner, and this is his channel news break.  Iran's enriched uranium stockpile exceeded the 300 kilogram limit set by the nuclear deal on Monday, according to the Iranian Fars News Agency.  This constitutes a direct violation of the 2015 Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, a nuclear pact the world's superpowers reached with Iran in 2015.  An Iranian source told Fars on Monday that the International Atomic Energy Agency found that the enriched uranium exceeded the ceiling of 300 kilograms.  We are aware of the media reports related to Iran's stockpile of low enriched uranium, an International Atomic Energy Agency spokesman said, and this being according to Reuters.  They also went on to say, our inspectors are on the ground and they will report to headquarters as soon as the low enriched uranium stockpile has been verified.  We told the Europeans that if more practical, more thorough and complete steps were taken, the measures taken to reduce Iran's commitments could be reversed.  Otherwise, we will continue, Iran's foreign ministry spokesperson, Saeed Abbas Mozavi, said in response to the announcement.  Earlier, Iran's ambassador and permanent representative to the United Nations, Majid Takhravanchi, said that, quote, if nothing happens in the next 10 days, end quote, Iran would start the second phase of increasing its stockpile of enriched uranium to an amount higher than the amount before the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action nuclear deal was implemented.
